passage_text: Alma would be spirit. Anda would be short for andale, which, I think is slang for 'do it already' 'hurry up' or other similar interpretations. Unless anda is also slang for something completely different. Different regions of Spanish-speaking countries have wildly differing phrases for the same meanings. I'll shut up now.

[ 2 syll. an-da, and-a ] The baby girl name Anda is pronounced as AE-ND-ah †. Anda is mainly used in the Spanish language. It is of Old Greek, Sanskrit, Spanish, and Gothic origin. From Spanish roots, its meaning is going. In addition, Anda is a variant form of Alexandra in the Spanish language. Anda is also a variant form of the Indian name Ananda. Anda is also a variant form of Andrea. Anda is also a variant form of the English, Italian, Portuguese, and Spanish name Fernanda. Anda is an unusual baby girl name. It is not ranked within the top 1000. In 2012, out of the family of girl names directly linked to Anda, Alexandra was the most regularly used.

By Gerald Erichsen. In its normal usage, the verb andar means to walk.. However, it is often used more broadly with a vague meaning that isn't readily translatable — meaning something along the line of to function, to do, to go along or even simply to be..
